column2: TEXAS DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.

column2: 2. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column8: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 3. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:

column4: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column10: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 9. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
10. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column6: It is not recommended to check

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column6: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way

column2: 12. This road sign means:
13. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.
column6: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column8: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column10: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.

column2: 14. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column6: Take a cold shower before driving.
column8: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column10: Stop drinking one hour before driving.

column2: 15. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column10: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 16. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column10: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 17. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the left side mirror.
column6: look into the right side mirror.
column10: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.

column2: 18. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: look at your interior rear-view mirror.

column2: 19. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.
column6: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 20. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column6: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column10: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.

column2: 21. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
22. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
23. A flashing red light:
column6: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column8: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.

column2: 24. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car approaching from the left.
column6: The car that is traveling faster.
column8: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column10: The car approaching from the right.

column2: 25. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
26. This sign warns that:
column10: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 27. This road sign indicates that:
column4: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.

column2: 28. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: stare straight ahead at all times.
column6: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column8: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column10: maintain focus toward the left of the road.

column2: 29. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
30. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column6: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column8: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column10: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
